originalText.text: I highly recommend purchasing from Constantina Dres at this showroom. We visited multiple times before we decided what to buy. Constantina could not have been more patient with us, and we were thankful for her advice.

text.text: I highly recommend purchasing from Constantina Dres at this showroom. We visited multiple times before we decided what to buy. Constantina could not have been more patient with us, and we were thankful for her advice.

originalText.text: DO NOT SHOP HERE.  THESE PEOPLE ARE CROOKS.  We ordered a large amount of appliances from them for our new renovation.  At first, they were very accommodating for the order.  Once they have your money, their attention goes elsewhere.  We received the wrong tub and a toilet that did not fit.  We returned the tub and the toilet, but they lost track of the toilet.  Because of the large number of orders and the long lead time, they didn't follow up and said we never returned the toilet.  We had to purchase another toilet from them due to the short lead time.  The entire time, we got the runaround and no responses from their salesperson Wayne Straz.  Will never do business with them again.

originalText.text: Forewarned is forearmed. The showroom is nice, the staff is very nice. The buying experience is very nice. So far so nice. Here is what everyone who deals in this business should know. Niceness and efficiency stops when you set foot onto 56th street. What  happened? The $700 sink arrived with a manufacturers defect. Replacement time? I am still waiting, and so is my contractor. No special treatment for a mid renovation screwup. Not nice, if you ask me? So buyer, open the box on the curb when they deliver and check it out before you sign off. No one else has. Where is the shower trim? Don't know. One of the laborers had signed for the shipment (my fault) and it was never delivered. But because someone signed for it I was responsible. New cost, $300. The brackets for the hotel shower rack were missing. They had been signed for. My mistake again, and another $65 in the hole. So whose fault was the missing items? Mine.  Had anyone warned me that this was a business where things regularly "fall off the truck?" Well no. But now you know. Do not trust anyone when it comes to honesty and quality control. Forewarned is forearmed.

originalText.text:
I had a terrible experience. I did a gut renovation and Mrs Geeta Nathai helped me select the fixtures . She sold me a Franke faucet for my kitchen and from the very beginning I noticed a poor flow . It was difficult to fill a pot with water . She told me it was the pressure in my building. I had no issues in my bathroom though . Soon the faucet leaked causing damage in my custom made cabinet. She replaced it with the warranty. The next faucet had the same issues so she told me to sell it on eBay . I replied it is a good way to get a negative feedback . She won’t help me further . I had to pay $200 to install a different faucet . She is stubborn and won’t acknowledge any problems . The faucet was top of the line $535.50 plus tax and installation.
Extremely poor non existent customer service . Stay away from this place . If a problem arises , they won’t  be there for you .

originalText.text: Stay away from this store!  Went into the store 1.5 hr before closing. Nobody was at the front desk to help customers. Found two women chatting in the back so I asked if someone can help. One of them answered very unwillingly, clearly I had interrupted their chit chat. finally she yelled one of the workers out and this guy was just as unpleasant. The store is crowded and poorly lit on an off street away from most furniture/home showrooms in the area. I now see why - they are clearly not up to the league.  Don’t bother wasting your time here and go else where.
